intro: Senecio violifolius, commonly known as the violet-leaved groundsels, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with violet, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Senecio violifolius is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
